oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-12-03 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 3, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Flatt & Scruggs (hosts/performers), guest performer George Hamilton IV, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1104th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Flatt & Scruggs; Archie Campbell; George Hamilton IV; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Flatt & Scruggs -- Before I Met You (Flatt & Scruggs) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Lester Flatt introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Lester Flatt) -- Lester Flatt and Grant Turner introduce George Hamilton IV -- Before This Day Ends (George Hamilton IV) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Lester Flatt) -- Lester Flatt introduces Tommy Jackson -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and Lester Flatt talk -- I'll Never Be Lonesome Again (Flatt & Scruggs) -- Lester Flatt introduces Chet Atkins -- San Antonio Rose (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Flatt, Lester; Scruggs, Earl; Hamilton, George, IV, 1937-; Graves, Josh; Sechler, Curly, 1919-; Warren, Paul; Tullock, Jake; Robbins, Marty
